Module AppointmentScheduler
Package Application.Controllers

Class LoginController

java.lang.Object
Application.Controllers.LoginController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class LoginController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
The LoginController providing logic behind LoginView with error handling and login credential verification that helps control application access to intended users.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Michael Short

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      The initialize method (inherited by Initializable) which runs automatically upon loading the controller's associated fxml file in the main application class. Initializes pre-declared table view components and links associated Part collections with their respective field properties to column categories.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - loads the url (automatically inherited and handled by the javafx framework)
      resourceBundle - loads the associated resourceBundle (automatically inherited and handled by the javafx framework)

    • onLoginSubmit

      public void onLoginSubmit(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws SQLException
      The Login Controller's credential validation method. Provides error handling and verifies user credential with the User Database and grants or denies access to the application accordingly.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Pre-generated and auto-handled event argument.
      Throws:
      SQLException - An exception for unexpected SQL issues (i.e. connectivity problems, query syntax errors, data type errors, etc)
